Lebesgue differentiation theorem

Given f ⁣:R2→R\func{f}{\R^2}{\R}f:R2→R, continuous, we define

[Arf](x,y)=12π∫−ππf(x+rcos⁡θ,y+rsin⁡θ) dθand[Mf](x,y)=sup⁡0<r<1[Arf](x,y).\br{A_rf}\p{x, y} = \frac{1}{2\pi} \int_{-\pi}^\pi f\p{x + r\cos\theta, y + r\sin\theta} \,\diff\theta \quad\text{and}\quad \br{Mf}\p{x, y} = \sup_{0<r<1} \br{A_rf}\p{x, y}.[Ar​f](x,y)=2π1​∫−ππ​f(x+rcosθ,y+rsinθ)dθand[Mf](x,y)=0<r<1sup​[Ar​f](x,y).

By a theorem of Bourgain, there is an absolute constant CCC so that

∥Mf∥L3(R2)≤C∥f∥L3(R2)for all f∈Cc(R2).\norm{Mf}_{L^3\p{\R^2}} \leq C\norm{f}_{L^3\p{\R^2}} \quad\text{for all } f \in C_c\p{\R^2}.∥Mf∥L3(R2)​≤C∥f∥L3(R2)​for all f∈Cc​(R2).

Here Cc(R)C_c\p{\R}Cc​(R) denotes the set of continuous functions of compact support.

Use this to show the following: If K⊆R2K \subseteq \R^2K⊆R2 is compact, then [ArχK](x,y)→1\br{A_r\chi_K}\p{x, y} \to 1[Ar​χK​](x,y)→1 as r→0r \to 0r→0 at almost every point (x,y)\p{x, y}(x,y) in KKK (with respect to Lebesgue measure). Here χK\chi_KχK​ denotes the characteristic function of KKK.
Solution.

First, let U⊆R2U \subseteq \R^2U⊆R2 be open and bounded, so χU\chi_UχU​ is lower semicontinuous. Thus, there exists a sequence of compactly supported continuous functions {fn}n\set{f_n}_n{fn​}n​ which increase to χU\chi_UχU​. Thus,

m({(x,y)∣∣[Mfn](x,y)∣>t})≤1t3∥Mfn∥L33≤C3t3∥fn∥L33≤C3t3∥χU∥L33=C3t3m(U).\begin{aligned} m\p{\set{\p{x, y} \mid \abs{\br{Mf_n}\p{x, y}} > t}} &\leq \frac{1}{t^3} \norm{Mf_n}_{L^3}^3 \\ &\leq \frac{C^3}{t^3} \norm{f_n}_{L^3}^3 \\ &\leq \frac{C^3}{t^3} \norm{\chi_U}_{L^3}^3 \\ &= \frac{C^3}{t^3} m\p{U}. \end{aligned}m({(x,y)∣∣[Mfn​](x,y)∣>t})​≤t31​∥Mfn​∥L33​≤t3C3​∥fn​∥L33​≤t3C3​∥χU​∥L33​=t3C3​m(U).​

Thus, because fnf_nfn​ increases to χU\chi_UχU​, we have

{(x,y)∣∣[MχU](x,y)∣>t}=⋃n=1∞{(x,y)∣∣[Mfn](x,y)∣>t},\begin{gathered} \set{\p{x, y} \mid \abs{\br{M\chi_U}\p{x, y}} > t} = \bigcup_{n=1}^\infty \set{\p{x, y} \mid \abs{\br{Mf_n}\p{x, y}} > t}, \end{gathered}{(x,y)∣∣[MχU​](x,y)∣>t}=n=1⋃∞​{(x,y)∣∣[Mfn​](x,y)∣>t},​

so by applying monotone convergence for measures,

m({(x,y)∣∣[MχU](x,y)∣>t})=lim⁡n→∞m({(x,y)∣∣[Mfn](x,y)∣>t})≤lim⁡n→∞C3t3m(U)=C3t3m(U).\begin{aligned} m\p{\set{\p{x, y} \mid \abs{\br{M\chi_U}\p{x, y}} > t}} &= \lim_{n\to\infty} m\p{\set{\p{x, y} \mid \abs{\br{Mf_n}\p{x, y}} > t}} \\ &\leq \lim_{n\to\infty} \frac{C^3}{t^3} m\p{U} \\ &= \frac{C^3}{t^3} m\p{U}. \end{aligned}m({(x,y)∣∣[MχU​](x,y)∣>t})​=n→∞lim​m({(x,y)∣∣[Mfn​](x,y)∣>t})≤n→∞lim​t3C3​m(U)=t3C3​m(U).​

Now let K⊆R2K \subseteq \R^2K⊆R2 be compact and let

En={(x,y) | lim sup⁡r→0 ∣[ArχK](x,y)−1∣>1n}.E_n = \set{\p{x, y} \st \limsup_{r\to0}\,\abs{\br{A_r\chi_K}\p{x, y} - 1} > \frac{1}{n}}.En​={(x,y)∣∣​r→0limsup​∣[Ar​χK​](x,y)−1∣>n1​}.

Let ε>0\epsilon > 0ε>0. By regularity of the Lebesgue measure, there exists U⊇KU \supseteq KU⊇K open and bounded such that m(U∖K)<εm\p{U \setminus K} < \epsilonm(U∖K)<ε. Observe

∣[ArχK](x,y)−1∣≤∣[ArχK](x,y)−[ArχU](x,y)∣+∣[ArχU](x,y)−1∣=∣[ArχU∖K](x,y)∣+∣[ArχU](x,y)−1∣  ⟹  lim sup⁡r→0 ∣[ArχK](x,y)−1∣≤lim sup⁡r→0 ∣[ArχU∖K](x,y)∣.\begin{aligned} \abs{\br{A_r\chi_K}\p{x, y} - 1} &\leq \abs{\br{A_r\chi_K}\p{x, y} - \br{A_r\chi_U}\p{x, y}} + \abs{\br{A_r\chi_U}\p{x, y} - 1} \\ &= \abs{\br{A_r\chi_{U \setminus K}}\p{x, y}} + \abs{\br{A_r\chi_U}\p{x, y} - 1} \\ \implies \limsup_{r\to0}\,\abs{\br{A_r\chi_K}\p{x, y} - 1} &\leq \limsup_{r\to0}\,\abs{\br{A_r\chi_{U \setminus K}}\p{x, y}}. \end{aligned}∣[Ar​χK​](x,y)−1∣⟹r→0limsup​∣[Ar​χK​](x,y)−1∣​≤∣[Ar​χK​](x,y)−[Ar​χU​](x,y)∣+∣[Ar​χU​](x,y)−1∣=∣∣​[Ar​χU∖K​](x,y)∣∣​+∣[Ar​χU​](x,y)−1∣≤r→0limsup​∣∣​[Ar​χU∖K​](x,y)∣∣​.​

Indeed, the second term tends to 000 because for all rrr sufficiently small, B((x,y),r)⊆UB\p{\p{x, y}, r} \subseteq UB((x,y),r)⊆U, so ArχU=1A_r\chi_U = 1Ar​χU​=1 for all small rrr. This shows that

En⊆{(x,y) | ∣[ArχU∖K](x,y)∣>1n}.E_n \subseteq \set{\p{x, y} \st \abs{\br{A_r\chi_{U \setminus K}}\p{x, y}} > \frac{1}{n}}.En​⊆{(x,y)∣∣​∣∣​[Ar​χU∖K​](x,y)∣∣​>n1​}.

But U∖KU \setminus KU∖K is open and bounded, so by our earlier estimate,

m(En)≤m({(x,y) | ∣[ArχU∖K](x,y)∣>1n})≤C3(1/n)3m(U∖K)≤C3n3ε.\begin{aligned} m\p{E_n} &\leq m\p{\set{\p{x, y} \st \abs{\br{A_r\chi_{U \setminus K}}\p{x, y}} > \frac{1}{n}}} \\ &\leq \frac{C^3}{\p{1/n}^3} m\p{U \setminus K} \\ &\leq C^3n^3\epsilon. \end{aligned}m(En​)​≤m({(x,y)∣∣​∣∣​[Ar​χU∖K​](x,y)∣∣​>n1​})≤(1/n)3C3​m(U∖K)≤C3n3ε.​

Sending ε→0\epsilon \to 0ε→0, we see that m(En)=0m\p{E_n} = 0m(En​)=0 for all n≥1n \geq 1n≥1, so

lim sup⁡r→0 ∣[ArχK](x,y)−1∣=0\limsup_{r\to0}\,\abs{\br{A_r\chi_K}\p{x, y} - 1} = 0r→0limsup​∣[Ar​χK​](x,y)−1∣=0

for a.e. (x,y)∈R2\p{x, y} \in \R^2(x,y)∈R2.
